channel.title: [Java] Email Sender
channel.description:
I used the JavaMail API and a small snippet I found on google to make a simple GUI wrapper to send emails. With small editing to the Email.java class you could potentially send emails from any address you wish, yes I have tested that to my own email. The only catch is I used the gmail servers, so it does require your gmail user and password. You can search the code as much as you want, I do not want your info, nor do I have any code in the program to grab it. There is no auto update feature either. Nor do I plan to update it. I just needed something for quick emailing.
Screeny: [img]http://soharuda.webuda.com/images/1337412656.png[/img]
Download source: [url=http://soharuda.webuda.com/images/1337440182.rar]Email Sender.rar[/url]

item.title: [Java] Email Sender
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:17, topic:442601”][quote author=_s link=topic=545286.msg3997082#msg3997082 date=1337436446]

ok now ditch the api and actually do the smtp shit yourself for lulz and learning

I would if I could find some actual documentation on it.
[/quote]or you just didn’t look.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_Mail_Transfer_Protocol
http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321

No, I did look, but I never knew the actual terms for the protocol. All I could think of was searching for the pop3 email stuff. I am not the best at finding names for something I just started looking into.[/quote]well i just googled ‘email send protocol’ and the first thing that popped up was SMTP, so rly i have nfi what else you would search for apart from ‘email protocol’, which still ends up with SMTP being listed along with POP3 and IMAP.

Read full topic

item.title: [Java] Email Sender
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote="_s, post:9, topic:442601"][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=545286.msg3997026#msg3997026 date=1337428928]

ok now ditch the api and actually do the smtp shit yourself for lulz and learning

I would if I could find some actual documentation on it.
[/quote]or you just didn’t look.

en.wikipedia.org

Simple Mail Transfer Protocol

Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is an Internet standard for electronic mail (email) transmission. First defined by RFC 821 in 1982, it was last updated in 2008 with Extended SMTP additions by RFC 5321, which is the protocol in widespread use today. Although electronic mail servers and other mail transfer agents use SMTP to send and receive mail messages, user-level client mail applications typically use SMTP only for sending messages to a mail server for relaying. For retrieving messages, cl...


http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321[/quote]
No, I did look, but I never knew the actual terms for the protocol. All I could think of was searching for the pop3 email stuff. I am not the best at finding names for something I just started looking into.

Read full topic
